hypothesis_content.title: Liquidity Crisis to Mean Reversion Transition
hypothesis_content.statement: During STRESS regime with BTC 1-day drop >15% and funding rates < -0.05%, a 4-hour close above the VWAP (volume-weighted average price) with decreasing sell volume (<50% of spike volume) signals exhaustion and transition to NEUTRAL regime, with 10% mean reversion likely within 3 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extreme negative funding indicates excessive short positioning. Price stabilization above VWAP with declining sell pressure suggests capitulation complete and forced covering imminent. Historical stress events show sharp mean reversion after such signals.
entry_conditions: 4-hour close above VWAP with sell volume < 50% of prior spike volume

exit_conditions.stop_loss: 5% loss from entry or new 1-day low

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If entry signal is followed by continued decline >30% of instances, or if mean reversion magnitude is not statistically significant.
